clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial Comparing Approaches to Shared Decision Making Skills Training for Clinicians
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Randomized Trial Comparing Approaches to Shared Decision Making Skills Training for Clinicians

brief_summary.textblock: The Health Decision Sciences Center (HDSC) staff has deployed different approaches to training clinicians to engage patients in shared decision making for common medical tests and treatments. The purpose of the study is to compare the effectiveness of shared decision making (SDM) skills training courses using standardized patient interactions (SPI) and written evaluations.

detailed_description.textblock:
There is limited evidence on approaches to training clinicians to engage patients in shared decision making for common medical tests and treatments. The purpose of the study is to compare the effectiveness of different approaches to shared decision making (SDM) skills training. Participants will be randomly assigned to either receive two decision aids or a webinar to review. Participants will also be randomly assigned to receive feedback on standardized patient interaction rating their shared decision making skills and highlighting opportunities for improvement or not. Clinician participants will be assigned to one of four intervention groups using a 2x2 factorial design:
Group 1: Decision aid viewing with feedback Group 2: Decision aid viewing and no feedback Group 3: webinar with feedback Group 4: webinar and no feedback
The pilot study will provide evidence on the comparative effectiveness and feasibility on training formats to determine if:
- Clinicians improved in SDM communication skills
- Clinicians have an increased confidence to use SDM with their patients
- The training is acceptable to clinicians

primary_outcome.description: Transcripts from standardized patient interactions will be scored using Braddock's Informed Decision Making framework to assess shared decision making skills

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who complete the training in the study time frame

secondary_outcome.measure: Confidence in shared decision making skills
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate confidence in shared decision making skills

arm_group.description: Group 1 receives three decision aids and feedback on their standardized patient (SPI) interaction rating their shared decision making skills and highlighting opportunities for improvement.

arm_group.arm_group_label: DA viewing with no SPI Feedback
arm_group.description: Group 2 receives three decision aids. This group does not receive any feedback from the SPI.

Group 3 receives an online, interactive webinar that focuses on SDM skills in clinical encounters and feedback on their standardized patient (SPI) interaction rating their shared decision making skills and highlighting opportunities for improvement.
Group 4 receives an online, interactive webinar that focuses on SDM skills in clinical encounters. This group does not receive any feedback from the SPI.

intervention.description: 1 hour online, interactive webinar that covers shared decision making skills in clinical encounters.
Participants will receive 3 decisions aids to review.
intervention.arm_group_label: DA viewing with no SPI Feedback

intervention.description: Rating of shared decision making skills and opportunities for improvement based on transcript of a standardized patient interaction

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults 18 and older
- English speaking
- Physician
- Nurse Practitioner
- Physician Assistant
- Registered Nurse
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not clinically active (research faculty only)
- Medical Trainees
- Medical Students
- Medical Assistants
- Social Workers
